author: 0x_qz
content: hey guys, is blobscan alive on Goerli?

author: parithosh
content: we tried getting it up, but seems like the non-finality period made it hard for it to sync up. would need to check with the team if they have a fix or if they plan on running one?

author: mikirov
content: Hey everyone. I read through the EIP-4844 and noticed it mentions  the blob tx contains `[chain_id, nonce, max_priority_fee_per_gas, max_fee_per_gas, gas_limit, to, value, data, access_list, max_fee_per_blob_gas, blob_versioned_hashes, y_parity, r, s]`. I am wondering how is the "blob sidecar" sent to the CL node?

author: mikirov
content: Furthermore i see that in the Go CLI tool the crafted transaction has a "Sidecar" field: https://github.com/ethpandaops/goomy-blob/blob/52526aa16d49498b72f7f49e958c065a9eaa9e17/txbuilder/blobtx.go#L33 Is it also RLP encoded along with everything else and sent over to the RPC server of the Node?

content: they confirmed to be working on running an instance too

author: kanagwa
content: Hi <@709649004559859772> we are 6 hours away from syncing our Goerli node. We aim to have the site operational by tomorrow

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Blob txs take two forms depending on the context. The ‚Äúnetwork representation‚Äù includes the blobs and their commitments in the RLP the other form doesn‚Äôt. Network representation is used both for eth_sendRawTransaction (to submit a tx to your node) and for devp2p tx gossip, while the other representation is used ‚Äúon chain‚Äù in the EL (e.g. when including txs in a block body).

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Correction: the two forms are both ‚Äúnetwork representations‚Äù, the first form with the blobs is called a PooledTransaction with the form without the blob is called the TransactionPayload.

author: ryanleeschneider
